solution_line_template: The distance to the destination is {time_taken_initial} hours * {speed_initial} miles/hour = <<{time_taken_initial}*{speed_initial}={distance}>>{distance} miles.
Traveling at {speed_new} miles per hour, it will take {distance} miles / ({speed_new} miles/hour) = <<{distance}/({speed_new})={time_taken_new}>>{time_taken_new} hours.
